title: How to Hire a Hardwood Floor Contractor

steps.headline: Get referrals from trusted friends and family members.
steps.description: If possible, look at the work that was done by the suggested contractor and make sure that you would be happy with it. Ask about the contractor's demeanor, reliability, work ethic and responsiveness to the needs of the client.

steps.headline: Select 2 or 3 hardwood floor contractors from the recommendations that you think would be a good match for your job.
steps.description: You will then continue the hiring process by comparing these 3 contractors based on some specific requirements.

steps.headline: Ask each contractor about qualifications and experience.
steps.description: Check that they are fully certified and licensed, per the requirements of their professional trade. If you feel it necessary, ask for copies of the documentation that verifies their credentials.

steps.headline: Request estimates from each of the floor contract workers.
steps.description: Be clear about the specifications of the job. You may want to write them down, and give a copy to each contractor so that you can compare the quotes. Additionally, ask each contractor to list out the materials that will be used and how much of each will be needed. This way you can make sure that each contractor is using the same supplies and quantities.

steps.headline: Learn about the steps involved in the project and the estimated time frame that the contractors expect the job to take.
steps.description: By having this information, you can keep an eye on the job and ensure that it is completed as originally stated.

steps.headline: Ensure that the wood floor contractors are covered by insurance in case of injury or damage of property.
steps.description: Ask for the paperwork that verifies this information. Contact any qualified business agencies that verify companies to make sure that the contractors are accredited and to determine whether there are any complaints filed against them.

steps.headline: Make your decision regarding which hardwood floor contractor you would like to commission for your job.
steps.description: Request a formal contract from the chosen contractor, confirming the cost of the job, the expected down payment, the materials that will be used, the timeframe and when the job will begin. Read this contract carefully, and make sure that you are satisfied with all the details before signing it. If there is anything on the contract that you are not sure about, be sure to bring it to the contractor's attention first.
